features: Turbo Handheld Steamer: This steamer combines the performance of an iron with the power of steam to instantly smooth out wrinkles in clothing and upholstery while killing 99.9 percent of germs, dust mites and bed bugs.Material: Plastic.Special feature : Corded

Easy To Use: This freestanding steamer features a 40 second heat up and a 7.3 ounce water tank for up to 15 minutes of continuous steam; Quilted aluminum steamer plate and built in creaser perform like an iron for a fresh pressed look

3 In 1 Attachment: Includes a silicone band to pull fabric taut for better results, a delicate fabric spacer to protect trims and fine fabrics, and a bristle brush to ensure steam penetrates fibers for a perfect press, even on heavy fabrics
Conair Fabric Steamers: Our fabric steamers keep your garments, upholstery, curtains and other home textiles smooth and fresh; Check out entire line including handheld, upright and travel steamers
Innovative Garment Care: From fabric shavers and traditional irons to garment steamers, both handheld and full size/upright, we make high quality garment care tools for all users
body.description: Experience the most powerful handheld fabric steamer with the Conair Turbo Extreme Steam Hand Held Fabric Steamer (model GS59). Advanced steam technology is driven by an exclusive 1875-Watt steam generator. The steam is hotter and the results are faster! 5 steam settings from delicate to supercharged turbo allow users to instantly release wrinkles on any garment or fabric and the built-in creaser for perfect pleats and folds. With 40-second heat up and up to 20-minute steam time, this powerful Conair garment steamer is the #1 selling garment steamer in the USA. The 3-in-1 attachment has a silicone band to pull fabric taut for easier steaming, a delicate fabric spacer, and bristle brush to loosen fibers for faster steam penetration. Instantly release wrinkles, refresh upholstery, and give garments a professional, fresh-pressed look with the powerful Conair Turbo Extreme Steam Handheld Fabric Steamer. Kills 99.9% of Bacteria (Bacteria reduction rate was measured after exposing the tested bacteria samples for 1 minute at a 1cm distance from the garment steamer’s faceplate. Bacteria tested were Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) and Klebsiella pneumoniae).；The product voltage arrange is 110V

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Powerful, compact, travels well
reviews.reviewText: Took it to New Zealand for 3 weeks. Used it several times, loved how fast it gets ready (less than 40 seconds), the small water reservoir (yes, I actually think smaller is better in this case for portability), and that it works with both 110/220V outlets. Only two minor nits. First, the AC voltage is selected via a manual switch on the bottom of the unit - wish it could auto-sense the voltage instead. If you leave it on 110V and plug it into a 220V outlet (say, in NZ), I suppose the unit might fry (dunno for sure). Also, when we returned to USA, I forgot about the switch and when I went to use it, it failed. After a few minutes I realized the issue, flipped the switch back to 110VAC and all was good again. The second nit is the small water reservoir. It's good enough for one, maybe two shirts depending on their size/material. Perfect for travel, but some may get annoyed that they need to refill the reservoir once or twice. It pops out for refilling very easily (just pull straight out with two fingers), so it's really no big deal. Really a great product, will be traveling with us many more times.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty Good & Got the Job Done
reviews.reviewText: Needed to get wrinkles out of a trench coat and a dress. I did not have time to take them to the dry cleaners to stream for me, so I ordered this. It came the next day, and I was able to get all the wrinkles out. Easy to use, got the job done. I recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Effective, just requires multiple refills
reviews.reviewText: Effective and powerful steamer, but it runs out of steam quickly. I refilled the reservoir about 5 times to steam the dress shown in the photos. It is also heavier than I expected.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Like the quick warm-up and ready to use , depending on material of the garment, it takes several times to go over and get wrinkles out , a little heavy to hold . But definitely serve the purpose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Near-professional results at home!
reviews.reviewText: This thing is amazing! i used a similar one in a hotel that offered it instead of an iron and I was hooked. I bought this for use at home and am delighted. I can steam things on a board or while hanging up and get good results, even on linen. It's so easy to use and store that I whip it out when I don't feel like lugging out the ironing board. It's amazing how simple it is to look great when it's really easy and quick! It heats up very quickly and has a large reservoir for water. It's probably too bulky to pack (unless you're checking luggage) but I love it for home use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great steamer, works great!! (Tip for steam not coming out)
reviews.reviewText: Great steamer, heats up fast and steams garments very well! I did run into an issue when I tried to use it for the first time. I plugged in the steamer and let it heat up, and once it was ready, I pressed the ‘Steam’ button but nothing was happening. I could tell the steamer was hot and I had filled the tank properly, however no steam was coming out. I called the Conair helpline and the rep was super helpful and informed me of what I needed to do to get it to work, and I was able to get it working in 5 min!If you run into this problem, here is what you need to do:- plug in steamer and ensure the water tank is full- allow it to heat up and when it lights up red to let you know it’s ready, press the ‘Steam’ button- then turn the entire steamer upside down, and hold it that way for a bit- flip it back and forth, sideways and upside down, to help loosen the air bubble that is blocking the steam- you should eventually here it trying to work, keep holding it upside down and flipping it around (carefully), and the steam will soon come out!****hope this helps!! :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for travel!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to bring with me on our elopement/honeymoon and used it to steam my entire wedding gown! Don’t get me wrong, that took a while given that the water chamber is intentionally small, but it does a great job and the voltage adapts for international use. In terms of every day use, the tank holds enough to steam a blouse and trousers and it heats up really fast. I can’t recommend it enough!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not clear on the directions on how to use
reviews.reviewText: My wife wanted one of these portable steamers to take on our vacation. She settled on this. I could not figure this out at first but finally got the hang of it.Follow the directions on filling the little water tank. Turn on (button on the bottom) and wait until the blue light stops blinking. Once it stops blinking, you will see the 5 levels (in red). I use only 3 so press the setting button until you see 3 red lights or to whatever level you like. What was confusing was the actual Steam button. I thought you had to hold the button while steaming but you don't. You press once for the steam to actually come out. Press again to have the steam stop. However, there is no indication that the actual steaming process is on. Yes, you have to turn it on using the power button but it will not steam until you press the Steam button. Also the instructions stating it takes 30 or 40 seconds to heat the water. It takes more like 1-2 minutes. Once it is heated, press the Steam button and the steam will come out (be careful as it burns). Then you can start steaming your clothing item.If you have a large clothing item or multiple items, the water tank will run out so you will need to refill. It will let you know that the water ran out once it starts making noise.I use the brush attachment which seems to help. Just make sure to attach it prior to turning on the unit because the face will get hot even if you have not press the Steam button.Overall, it does work. We used it multiple times so far and no issues. Just the first time trying to figure out as I did not know you have to press the Steam button once to actually have the steam come out. I thought you had to hold it.Also don't steam your clothing item against a door or wall. The steam will go through the clothing and may damage your door or wall. Also I believe you only should use it upright. It may not work if you are steaming horizontal.The steamer is a decent size so don't think it is small. Check the dimensions as it is pretty big but we should put it in our suitcase. I do recommend this. Let's see how durable it is.
Best steamer I have ever had……it’s true you get what you pay for.
Tiene buen vapor, caliente rápido y Plancha muy bien
Good build quality but not as much effective for badly creased clothes. Does the job for light garments
